fields.description:
When running an instance a private network index is allocated by randomly checking the database for a free index. It is possible that concurrent requests can pick the same index leading to an error when all but one of the conflicting transactions commits.

An example is:

{code}
# (euca-run-instances emi-B1153E98 &); euca-run-instances emi-B1153E98
RunInstancesType: javax.persistence.PersistenceException: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: Could not execute JDBC batch update
RESERVATION	r-29343BF8	013765657871	default
INSTANCE	i-D6D04567	emi-B1153E98	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0	pending		0		m1.small	2012-11-21T17:34:51.203Z	PARTI00	eki-24F23A88	monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store
{code}

The error logged is:

{code}
Tue Nov 20 23:40:27 2012 ERROR [VmControl:VmControl.16] [com.eucalyptus.vm.VmControl.runInstances(VmControl.java):186] java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.persistence.PersistenceException: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: Could not execute JDBC batch update
java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.persistence.PersistenceException: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: Could not execute JDBC batch update
        at com.eucalyptus.util.Exceptions.toUndeclared(Exceptions.java:235)

        at com.eucalyptus.vm.VmControl.runInstances(VmControl.java:174)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:616)
        at org.mule.model.resolvers.AbstractEntryPointResolver.invokeMethod(AbstractEntryPointResolver.java:147)
        at org.mule.model.resolvers.ReflectionEntryPointResolver.invoke(ReflectionEntryPointResolver.java:127)
        at org.mule.model.resolvers.DefaultEntryPointResolverSet.invoke(DefaultEntryPointResolverSet.java:50)
        at org.mule.component.DefaultLifecycleAdapter.intercept(DefaultLifecycleAdapter.java:202)
        at org.mule.component.AbstractJavaComponent.invokeComponentInstance(AbstractJavaComponent.java:82)
        at org.mule.component.AbstractJavaComponent.doOnCall(AbstractJavaComponent.java:73)
        at org.mule.component.AbstractComponent.onCall(AbstractComponent.java:87)
        at org.mule.model.seda.SedaService$ComponentStageWorker.run(SedaService.java:533)
        at org.mule.work.WorkerContext.run(WorkerContext.java:310)
        at edu.emory.mathcs.backport.java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:665)
        at edu.emory.mathcs.backport.java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:690)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:679)
Caused by: javax.persistence.PersistenceException: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: Could not execute JDBC batch update
        at org.hibernate.ejb.AbstractEntityManagerImpl.convert(AbstractEntityManagerImpl.java:1235)
        at org.hibernate.ejb.AbstractEntityManagerImpl.convert(AbstractEntityManagerImpl.java:1168)

Caused by: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: Could not execute JDBC batch update

        at org.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.flush(SessionImpl.java:1206)

Caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Batch entry 0 insert into metadata_network_indices (creation_timestamp, last_update_timestamp, metadata_perm_uuid, version, metadata_display_name, metadata_last_state, metadata_state, metadata_state_change_stack, metadata_account_name, metadata_account_id, metadata_unique_name, metadata_user_id, metadata_user_name, metadata_network_index_bogus_id, metadata_network_index_extant_network_fk, metadata_network_index, id) values ('2012-11-20 23:40:27.702000 -08:00:00', '2012-11-20 23:40:27.702000 -08:00:00', '84b5524f-6143-47cc-8204-1150056a5ba9', '0', '854:9', 'FREE', 'FREE', 'n/a', NULL, '013765657871', '013765657871:854:9', 'V4UKHMM6QBXKYGAHQZJWK', 'admin', '854:9', '8ae5819c3af60c5f013af612a6df000e', '9', '8ae5819c3b1b97fe013b21e92cb600f5') was aborted.  Call getNextException to see the cause.

java.lang.RuntimeException

It looks like the impact of this is failure of a single request, retrying the failed run instances request should result in success.
fields.summary: Private network index allocation is not thread safe

comments.body: The error is not exactly the same, but I think this issue occurs in the logs attached to EUCA-4192.

Concurrent private network index allocation is now supported, we do not support concurrent allocation for the extant network.

This means you may see failures in tests, but the cause will be insertion into "metadata_extant_network" rather than "metadata_network_indices".
